list_definition.definition: a small mark or stain (made by mud, paint etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She was trying to remove a spot of grease from her skirt.

list_definition.definition: a small, round mark of a different colour/color from its background

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: His tie was blue with white spots.

list_definition.definition: a pimple or red mark on the skin caused by an illness etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She had measles and was covered in spots.

list_definition.definition: a place or small area, especially the exact place (where something happened etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: There was a large number of detectives gathered at the spot where the body had been found.
Can I borrow a spot of sugar?
She spotted him eventually at the very back of the crowd.
No-one watching the play was able to spot the murderer.

The center spot was presented to the receptive center.
The interaction conditions are significantly changing with the laser focus spot position.
Oocytes matured off axis developed a maturation spot more eccentric than that in oocytes matured in an upright position.
